member.name: IAudioSessionControl.GetDisplayName
member.summary: The GetDisplayName method retrieves the display name for the audio session.
member.param: Pointer to a pointer variable into which the method writes the address of a null-terminated, wide-character string that contains the display name. The method allocates the storage for the string. The caller is responsible for freeing the storage, when it is no longer needed, by calling the function. For information about CoTaskMemFree, see the Windows SDK documentation.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.GetGroupingParam
member.summary: The GetGroupingParam method retrieves the grouping parameter of the audio session.
member.param: Output pointer for the grouping-parameter GUID. This parameter must be a valid, non-NULL pointer to a caller-allocated GUID variable. The method writes the grouping parameter into this variable.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.GetIconPath
member.summary: The GetIconPath method retrieves the path for the display icon for the audio session.
member.param: Pointer to a pointer variable into which the method writes the address of a null-terminated, wide-character string that specifies the fully qualified path of an .ico, .dll, or .exe file that contains the icon. The method allocates the storage for the string. The caller is responsible for freeing the storage, when it is no longer needed, by calling the function. For information about icon paths and CoTaskMemFree, see the Windows SDK documentation.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.GetState
member.summary: The GetState method retrieves the current state of the audio session.

param.name: pRetVal
param.para: Pointer to a variable into which the method writes the current session state. The state must be one of the following enumeration values:
These values indicate that the session state is active, inactive, or expired, respectively. For more information, see Remarks.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.RegisterAudioSessionNotification
member.summary: The RegisterAudioSessionNotification method registers the client to receive notifications of session events, including changes in the stream state.
member.param: Pointer to a client-implemented interface. If the method succeeds, it calls the method on the client's IAudioSessionEvents interface.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.SetDisplayName
member.summary: The SetDisplayName method assigns a display name to the current session.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated, wide-character string that contains the display name for the session.

Pointer to the event-context GUID. If a call to this method generates a name-change event, the session manager sends notifications to all clients that have registered interfaces with the session manager. The session manager includes the EventContext pointer value with each notification. Upon receiving a notification, a client can determine whether it or another client is the source of the event by inspecting the EventContext value. This scheme depends on the client selecting a value for this parameter that is unique among all clients in the session. If the caller supplies a NULL pointer for this parameter, the client's notification method receives a NULL context pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.SetGroupingParam
member.summary: The SetGroupingParam method assigns a session to a grouping of sessions.
member.param: The new grouping parameter. This parameter must be a valid, non-NULL pointer to a grouping-parameter GUID. For more information, see Remarks.

Pointer to the event-context GUID. If a call to this method generates a grouping-change event, the session manager sends notifications to all clients that have registered interfaces with the session manager. The session manager includes the EventContext pointer value with each notification. Upon receiving a notification, a client can determine whether it or another client is the source of the event by inspecting the EventContext value. This scheme depends on the client selecting a value for this parameter that is unique among all clients in the session. If the caller supplies a NULL pointer for this parameter, the client's notification method receives a NULL context pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.SetIconPath
member.summary: The SetIconPath method assigns a display icon to the current session.
member.param: Pointer to a null-terminated, wide-character string that specifies the path and file name of an .ico, .dll, or .exe file that contains the icon. For information about icon paths, see the Windows SDK documentation.

Pointer to the event-context GUID. If a call to this method generates an icon-change event, the session manager sends notifications to all clients that have registered interfaces with the session manager. The session manager includes the EventContext pointer value with each notification. Upon receiving a notification, a client can determine whether it or another client is the source of the event by inspecting the EventContext value. This scheme depends on the client selecting a value for this parameter that is unique among all clients in the session. If the caller supplies a NULL pointer for this parameter, the client's notification method receives a NULL context pointer.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The audio endpoint device has been unplugged, or the audio hardware or associated hardware resources have been reconfigured, disabled, removed, or otherwise made unavailable for use.
The Windows audio service is not running.

member.name: IAudioSessionControl.UnregisterAudioSessionNotification
member.summary: The UnregisterAudioSessionNotification method deletes a previous registration by the client to receive notifications.
member.param: Pointer to a client-implemented interface. The client passed this same interface pointer to the session manager in a previous call to the method. If the UnregisterAudioSessionNotification method succeeds, it calls the method on the client's IAudioSessionEvents interface.

returns.para: If the method succeeds, it returns S_OK. If it fails, possible return codes include, but are not limited to, the values shown in the following table.

listheader.description: The specified interface was not previously registered by the client or has already been removed.

summary.para: The IAudioSessionControl interface enables a client to configure the control parameters for an audio session and to monitor events in the session. The method initializes a stream object and assigns the stream to an audio session. The client obtains a reference to the IAudioSessionControl interface on a stream object by calling the method with parameter riid set to REFIID IID_IAudioSessionControl.

Alternatively, a client can obtain the IAudioSessionControl interface of an existing session without having to first create a stream object and add the stream to the session. Instead, the client calls the method with parameter AudioSessionGuid set to the session GUID.
The client can register to receive notification from the session manager when clients change session parameters through the methods in the IAudioSessionControl interface.
When releasing an IAudioSessionControl interface instance, the client must call the interface's Release method from the same thread as the call to IAudioClient.GetService that created the object.
The IAudioSessionControl interface controls an audio session. An audio session is a collection of shared-mode streams. This interface does not work with exclusive-mode streams.
For a code example that uses the IAudioSessionControl interface, see Audio Events for Legacy Audio Applications.
